headline.main: U.S. Flier Dropped Bombs on Foe Instant Before Death at Milne Bay; Bombardier Who Pestered Superior to Be Allowed to Go on First Combat Mission Killed by Shell in Flying Fortress

lead_paragraph: SOMEWHERE IN AUSTRALIA, Sept. 1 (U.P.) -- Bombardier Sergeant Earl W. Snyder of Wilkes-Barre, Pa., died with his hand clutching his bomb release and his head hanging over his bomb sight a split-second after he had sent his bombs down on the Japanese invasion fleet in Milne Bay, his comrades said today.
abstract: US soldiers on manoeuvres, Australia, illus
